Description:
resolving design and development problems
managing budgets and project resources
scheduling material and equipment purchases and deliveries
making sure the project complies with legal requirements
assessing the sustainability and environmental impact of projects
ensuring projects run smoothly and structures are completed within budget and on time
Managing, directing and monitoring progress during each phase of a project
Making sure sites meet legal guidelines, and health and safety requirements
Assessing the environmental impact and risks connected to project
Reviews plan and shop drawings approval prior to installation at site
Evaluate material submittal specifications in accordance with the project specifications
Inspect completed installations to insure conformance to design
Review detail of contract agreement for consultants and contractors
Schedules, assigns, plans and monitor the work of personnel performing a variety of projectsSkills
Skills:
Established track record of working in the Civil and Construction sector as an engineer.
Proficient in using 2D and 3D civil engineering software like AutoCAD, Revit, HEC-HMS, and BIMsight.
Showing excellent performance in distinct setups to complete ongoing construction projects with high efficiency.
Excellent report writing skills.
Project management and supervision skills.
Professional technical education in Civil Engineering with expertise in Project Management.
It's mandatory to have a UPDA certificate (minimum Grade C).
Can join immediately.

Preferred.Nationality: Bangladesh; India; Nepal; Philippines; Sri Lanka
